website_summaries.verdict: A well-respected product with a history of some minor sound quality flaws.
cons: Not good for Skype or intimate vocal recordings

customer_reviews.title: Audio Quality Well Above the Price Break
customer_reviews.text: This mic was so much better than I expected from a USB device. So much so, I felt compelled to create a short 6.5 minute video review. I used the mic to record the audio in this review and hope that the quality sound helps you in your search for a mic that delivers way above it's price break. BTW - I suggest you plug in some good headphones to catch a better audio experience when watching this video. In summary, well build, quality manufacturing and really crispy, no-noise mic that's simple to hookup and use. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Smudge

customer_reviews.title: Great USB Microphone - Super Easy Set-up!
customer_reviews.text: Great microphone! People used to have so much trouble hearing me on Skype/video calls using my webcam. This mic have changed it completely - also sounds so much better in videos. I paired it with the AT8458 shockmount and Rode PSA1 stand, and the whole set-up works wonderfully. Also using the WindTech PopGard which works well, though in hindsight, could have just gone for a clip on filter.
customer_reviews.author: R. Bank

customer_reviews.title: Poor cardioid rejection, picks up tons of noise.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use with Skype. Unpleasantly surprised, the rear rejection is pretty mediocre - the mic picks up a lot more noise than I would expect. Worse, the isolation for the capsule must be pretty mediocre as with the mic on my desk it is absolutely unusable while typing. Mechanically conducted noise is really loud. Nice that it includes this small stand, and the mic is compact and looks sharp, but I tested it against the Blue Yeti and while you could go either way re: sound quality, the practical aspects with the Yeti's better rejection and isolation make it no contest.
customer_reviews.author: Bennett Prescott

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for vocalists
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using the AT4047 in the studio and fell in love with it. I wanted to get something for home recording that had that same stellar quality and the AT2020 is perfect! I’ve strictly been using this for recording vocals and it delivers beautifully. It has a clarity and richness to the sound that is missing for me with the Blue Yeti (sorry, Yeti). Audio Technica mic’s just work really well with my voice and give it the extra oomf I like for my home recordings.
customer_reviews.author: Andie_K

customer_reviews.title: excellent quality and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality and easy to use. Be sure to watch your input levels to prevent distortion, something my brother taught me, but I am a big fan of this mic. Forgive my less than top quality speaking/recording skills but even with that hindrance the AT2020 USB microphone performed admirably.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for virtual meetings or band livestreams.
customer_reviews.text: With this new world that we live in, remote meetings are the norm. I used headphones and Bluetooth solutions before trying this. Long story short, you plug this in and it works. Plug in headphones and you can mix between computer audio from your meeting and your headphones so you can hear yourself. It has a excellent audio quality from computer meetings, and lots of headroom before clipping. Highly, highly recommend for meetings, capturing audio from guitars and bands, and you can even get a adaptor to plug the USB into a type C for your phone. No issues, no complaints, works perfect each and everytime.
customer_reviews.author: Rgreen

customer_reviews.title: My go-to mic for 5+ years
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had the 2020 for a very long time, and it finally decided to die about a month ago. I liked it so much that I decided just to buy it again. The 2020+ sounds great, looks great, and connects with ease. I have it on a suspension arm with a pop filter. I haven’t used this for streaming or podcasting, just talking with friends over VoIP and playing video games. I wouldn’t bother with any other mic.
customer_reviews.author: Henry D

customer_reviews.title: Will make you vocally attractive
customer_reviews.text: I spend about half my life at my PC and a lot of that time is spent on voice chat. Now that I've upgraded to this mic I get constant compliments on how soothing and relaxing and sexy my voice is. It's really helped me regain my confidence, because I'm actually ugly as sin.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Aguilar

customer_reviews.title: Phenominal Sound Quality
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely blown away by the quality of this mic. The sound is unmatched compared to any other mic I have tried, and I sometimes find myself in Audacity recording random stuff just to listen to the smoothness. I matched a random pop filter with this also from Amazon, and they work great together in unison. I literally have no complaints as of yet about this product, and I don't foresee any coming barring any sort of hardware issues. If I were to come across any I will update this review in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Meh for online calls and gaming
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is meh. I spend a lot of time in calls online and use this for gaming. My friends noticed only a small increase in quality over my cheap blue nessie & only when I asked if I sounded any clearer or if there was any noticeable improvement. Half tempted to return it, after using it a few times it just doesnt seem to be worth the price tag for what I use it for.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Sound Quality !
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to teach music lessons remotely and also to do some home recording for myself and my students. I play the flute, which can be difficult as a DIY recording project. This mic works very well. I'm happy with the sound and so far, I can use it for both speaking and playing during lessons, which makes my set up much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle526

customer_reviews.title: Professional quality mic
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this for narrating, and the quality is everything I could have hoped for and more. I’m using it professionally in a home-made studio, and I have a tip for you if you’re also using a home studio and want to reduce echo for free. I haven’t tried this on the tripod it comes with, only with a desk clamp mic arm, but here it is: rubber band the mic packaging foam around the back of the mic. It made so much difference for me. Anyway, I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Solid Buy.
customer_reviews.text: This microphone was very easy to set up and get right into speaking without any complex setup. It has a good ability to block sounds such as key board clicking as long as you position it correctly. I would recommend getting an elevated stand to further distance it away from the keyboard and reduce vibration impacts from the desk being picked up in the device. I would recommend this device if you plan on getting a headset more focused on audio quality than one that has both mic and audio.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Awesome microphone!
customer_reviews.text: Before buying, I did a really deep research on microphones and I was on a budget under $200. This beauty is just amazing! Awesome sound and amazing quality! I strongly recommend it for voice over work!
customer_reviews.author: Raindrop

customer_reviews.title: It Does What Its Supposed To Do - Quality Sound
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mic because my Blue Yeti had a persistent high pitched noise that I could not eliminate. I did research and decided to buy the Audio-Technica. I am very pleased with the sound quality. Even without the high-pitched noise, the Audio-Technica is superior to the Yeti - in my opinion. My Yeti worked for several months and I have recordings from both mice and the AT is clearly better quality. I am primarily using it to record speech and it does a great job. I can recommend with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Asaro

customer_reviews.title: Condenser USB Microphone
customer_reviews.text: Great product, provides clean high quality sound. Regulator for mixing computer and mic a little bit too coarse but does the job. Using with Eastshining Upgraded Adjustable Microphone Suspension Boom Scissor Arm Stand with Shock Mount Mic Clip Holder. Tried with Studio One and Adobe Audition software. Very satisfied with performance.
customer_reviews.author: A. Shafir

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound and Mix Feature
customer_reviews.text: I sold very high-end (Sanken) microphones for many years and was looking for a mic for my webcasts. This mic sounds very good and gives me a "Radio Voice". What Iike in addition are the two controls, one for mixing my own voice with the audio it receives from the PC and the other for overall volume. And it installed automatically and flawlessly. Whenever someone could not afford (or need) a Sanken I recommended AT, and this mic did not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Ucik

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I had an XLR microphone and a complicated digital audio interface, but something about the crazy wiring in my house made an almost constant hum on my recordings. I got this mic and voila! Smooth sailing with many hours of use. And so simple to use, just plug into a USB port and open my DAW. I don't think I even had to go into Settings to set it up.
customer_reviews.author: Jon S. Kerr

customer_reviews.title: Superb
customer_reviews.text: One of the best microphones I have ever owned. The only downside with this step up in sound quality is that now all of my guild mates can hear the depression in my voice. They call me Eeyore now. 10/10 would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Dillman

customer_reviews.title: It was so simple to add to the computer and with the onboard headphone plug you can get direct playback in the headphones from y
customer_reviews.text: The Audio-Technica AT2020usb sounds incredible for voices and speaking. I have not tried it with singing. It was so simple to add to the computer and with the onboard headphone plug you can get direct playback in the headphones from your computer to hear what it sounds like or select the mic mix and get a direct feed from the mic to the ear phones. I put this on the RODE PSA1 Swivel Mount Studio Microphone Boom and it works great. Stays where I want it to and is quiet. This has been the best microphone I have used in a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Very clear, and little too crisp at times. Works with iPad/iPhone
customer_reviews.text: This microphone is very crisp, clear, and sounds very professional. With that there are a few frequencies that can sound harsh especially in a male pop style vocal and can be fixed with a little EQ. On more melodic subdued vocals this mic sounds gorgeous. I find I have to use a foam filter to tame the crispness a little unless I was to try and dial in the EQ. Also this works with iPad and iPhone with just a usb to lightning adapter. No additional power required.
customer_reviews.author: SmithFam

customer_reviews.title: Good Mic for Podcasting, Screen Recording, etc.
customer_reviews.text: I create e-Learning courses and use this mic and Camtasia to record demonstration videos of software as it's being used. I just plugged the mic into my laptop's USB port, adjusted the mic gain in Windows, selected the USB mic option in Camtasia (which also has its own gain settings), and started recording. Good mic for this purpose. Fairly clean sound. Not quite as directional as I would like--still picks up a tiny bit of room noise/echo, but it's much better than other setups I've tried. I tried the Samson G Track USB, but couldn't get the thing to work properly, so I returned it and purchased the AT2020.
customer_reviews.author: Will Corsair

customer_reviews.title: Save your money.

customer_reviews.title: Yes! Yes! Yes! Great product. Awesome clear quality microphone and headphones. Stand needs work. Overall satisfied!

It's not wobbly, but the screw over time becomes lose and breaks apart, requiring you to super glue a part or two back together. I went ahead and bought another stand instead for my own needed usage. But other than that, I am greatly satisfied with my order! Length of cord is a good length. Pretty long. Microphone works great, very clear quality of sound. Nothing bad to really say about it. I still use this today! Thank you so much for this!

customer_reviews.title: Great microphone...

It should not have so much statice and such poor quality with such careful use and in less than a year.

customer_reviews.title: Great sound for the money.

The headphone jack is a nice work around to any recording issues with latency.

A device that is not even a year old and is only used once or twice a week. Trying to source a replacement diaphragm is so hard and confusing. The sound quality is good but sloppy product as it relates to durability.

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE IT

This bad boy here liberated me from those days! I was very pleased that it was a plug 'n play, and that no additional drivers were needed. I just set it up, plugged it in, and it has worked without a hitch. The stand it comes with SUCKS though, and you'll have to turn it towards you just to prevent everything from tipping over. This is a MUST-HAVE for any entry level or beyond microphone!!

product_meta.title: Audio-Technica AT2020USB+ Cardioid Condenser USB Microphone, Black, With Built-In Headphone Jack & Volume Control
product_meta.description: Color:Black| style:AT2020USB+Equipped with a USB output, the AT2020USB+ is designed for digitally capturing music or any acoustic audio source using your favorite recording software. The microphone offers the critically acclaimed, award-winning sound of the AT2020, with studio-quality articulation and intelligibility perfect for singer/songwriters, podcasters, voice-over artists, field recorders, and home studio recorders. The AT2020USB+ features a built-in headphone jack with volume control that allows you to directly monitor your microphone signal with no delay. It also offers mix control that blends microphone and pre-recorded audio. The microphone’s cardioid pickup pattern delivers excellent off-axis rejection, while its A/D converter with a 16-bit, 44.1/48 kHz sampling rate ensures extremely articulate sound reproduction. Audio-Technica’s state-of-the-art design and manufacturing techniques ensure that the microphone complies with the company’s renowned consistency and reliability standards.
